title: Polarizability of the kaonic helium atom
authors: D.T. Aznabayev, A.K. Bekbaev, V.I. Korobov
abstract:
The static dipole polarizability of metastable states in the kaonic helium
atoms is studied. We use the complex coordinate rotation method to properly
account for the resonant nature of the states. Our calculations show that some
of the states are not stable with respect to collisional quenching in a dense
helium target and should not be detected in the experiment.
